dependencies.description:
Intel oneAPI Math Kernel Library (Intel oneMKL; formerly Intel Math
Kernel Library or Intel MKL), is a library of optimized math routines
for science, engineering, and financial applications. Core math
functions include BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, fast Fourier
transforms, and vector math. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and
using this software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the
software license agreements at https://intel.ly/393CijO.
dependencies.name: mkl

dependencies.description:
Multi-backend Keras. Keras 3 is a new multi-backend implementation of
the Keras API, with support for TensorFlow, JAX, and PyTorch.
dependencies.name: py-keras

dependencies.description:
metric-learn contains efficient Python implementations of several
popular supervised and weakly-supervised metric learning algorithms. As
part of scikit-learn-contrib, the API of metric-learn is compatible with
scikit-learn, the leading library for machine learning in Python. This
allows to use all the scikit-learn routines (for pipelining, model
selection, etc) with metric learning algorithms through a unified
interface.
dependencies.name: py-metric-learn

dependencies.description:
MiniSom is a minimalistic and Numpy based implementation of the Self
Organizing Maps (SOM). SOM is a type of Artificial Neural Network able
to convert complex, nonlinear statistical relationships between high-
dimensional data items into simple geometric relationships on a low-
dimensional display. Minisom is designed to allow researchers to easily
build on top of it and to give students the ability to quickly grasp its
details. The project initially aimed for a minimalistic implementation
of the Self-Organizing Map (SOM) algorithm, focusing on simplicity in
features, dependencies, and code style. Although it has expanded in
terms of features, it remains minimalistic by relying only on the numpy
library and emphasizing vectorization in coding style.
dependencies.name: py-minisom

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: Invoke py.test as distutils command with dependency resolution.
dependencies.name: py-pytest-runner

dependencies.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.
dependencies.name: py-scikit-learn

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.
dependencies.name: py-seaborn

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.
dependencies.name: py-tensorflow

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

description:
Variants of the synthetic minority oversampling technique (SMOTE) for

name: py-smote-variants
